title: Set SQL Server connection for all users by default
author: deanoblock
body_snippet:
Use case is where I have many users remoting into a Server,  set mRemoteNG to use the SQL Server connection settings by default.  Where I can maintain a list of machines on the shopfloor and support users can login and load the SQL Server connections automatically without having to manually configure the advanced settings.

## Feature request Behavior
1.New user login to a windows server for the first time
2. Windows User Profile is created
3. User opens mRemoteNG
4. SQL Server connection ...

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
How do you deploy the software onto the user's clients? 
If I remember correctly (need to check), mRemoteNG has two configuration files. One is the user configuration, and the other is the connection config. Both files are stored in the Appdata folder of mRemoteNG. If you create a default user configuration file containing the Database settings, you can just replace the file of the user and he's ready to go.

comments.author: deanoblock
comments.snippet:
This is on Microsoft Server 2022 with remote desktop services.  Since mRemoteNG is per machine installation, any user new or existing logging in has the application already.   
I think I know where you are going with this, I can create a default configs then create a local logon batch script to copy them into the users %appdata% location.  A little messy but I'll give it try.  However I still think its a useful FR to have the connection config live in $programdata

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet: Got it. In this case the only option (workaround until this feature is added) I see is to alter the default profile, but this obviously only works if the profile was not created before and roaming profile is disabled...
